author: Jennifer Crothers
title: EastEnders' John Altman plans to become an MP
text:
Celebs EastEnders' John Altman plans to become an MP Nasty Nick wants to turn his hand to standing up for the people and has very firm ideas of what he wants to change Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Former EastEnders star John Altman is planning a career change - he wants to become an MP. 
The actor, who played Nasty Nick Cotton in the soap, says he’s fed up with student debt, potholes and only rich people being able to afford education. 
So now John, 64, plans to make a stand and have his voice heard, although he’s as yet unsure what party he would run for. 
“Someone is interested in putting me forward as an MP,” he told the Daily Star . “So we shall see. Watch this space.” John wants to reintroduce student grants (Photo: REX) John as Nick Cotton with his on screen mum Dot (played by June Brown) (Photo: BBC) John first appeared on EastEnders in 1985 Read More EastEnders fans thrilled when June Brown's onscreen son John Altman interrupts TV tribute filming with flowers 
He feels passionately about education spending and a reintroduction of grants, as well as improving the state of the roads after a cyclist died in Surrey last year when he collided with a pothole. 
“There seem to be a lot of boys from Harrow and Eton becoming famous now,” he explains.“I think it’s very wrong that people can’t afford to go to college. John isn't sure which party he'll stand for yet (Photo: DAILY MIRROR) 
“ Tony Blair introducing student loans was a disgrace. That is one of the top five things I would eliminate. I would put the money that they put into billion pound missiles back into education. 
“Having that debt is not a good start in life and it’s not going to encourage new talent from across the board to emerge and keep out country great. It’s counter productive.” 
John recently surprised his former screen mum June Brown during BBC's celebratory tribute for her 90th birthday.
